desc.desc: Solution mainly for business customers to manage, plan and generate profit from their charging infrastructure for electric vehicles. Frontend (built with Angular + Android/iOS mobile apps) + backend (huge microservice matrix) together formed large, but robust platform, that stayed behind the numerous hardware in field. I helped develop systems that:

Unified Functional Testing is enterprise tool providing UI and API testing module. UI module was used mainly for long E2E tests, where we were including not only frontend parts (Angular web app), but also for ex. SAP, direct database queries and REST API calls. API module is great for functional testing - especially for pure backend teams focused on creating REST interfaces. Visual coding flows can be extended with functionalities written in C#.

Used on project - eMobility.

I have basic knowledge of Pivotal Cloud Foundry (run/stop/restart apps).

Used on project - eMobility.

Application Lifecycle Management - it basically served testers as storage and runner for the tests. However, it lacks connection to JIRA, so connecting tests to story tickets is tricky. On the other hand, UFT (test automation creation tool that we used) is directly integrated into ALM.

Used on project - eMobility.

Elasticsearch tool for app logs analysis.

Used on project - eMobility.

Documentation/design tool for RESTful APIs - as a backend tester this was my everyday helper.

Used on project - eMobility.

Awesome framework which picks the best from all other test automation tools. Suitable for whole testing pyramide cascade (functional -> integration -> E2E testing). Tests are written in JS/TS, assertions are provided by well known libraries Mocha and Chai JS. No browser driver instance needed in between (like Selenium). Provides nicely designed local web runner, with detailed live reporting. Easily integrable to CI/CD.

Used on personal project - Chlebiatko Blog (see the other section, for more details).

Used on project - eMobility (migration from UFT to Cypress).

Issue tracking tool for software developement projects.

Used on project - eMobility.

desc.desc:
Postman (or similar tool) is must for backend tester. You can easily store and create custom enviroments from interfaces, you can have different collections of variables used in requests (with different scope). I usually make use of it, while performing manual tests. Postman is also capable of automation and chaining requestes with JS (using Mocha or Chai assertions).

Used on project - eMobility.

Each app within the microservice matrix had own MySQL database, so it was necessary to know how to compose SQL queries to write good assertions in test scripts and to maniuplate the data manually (if needed).

Used on project - eMobility.
